comments:

Markus, can you investigate?

Channing, do you have an idea where this came from. A small source snippet to reproduce?

There isn't really a repeatable test case. All I did was attempt to rename a static method (alt+shift+r) on windows. I also notice that the logs are full "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: L/DoorsView/test/complyserve/doorsview/utils/LabelsTest.java".

(In reply to comment #2)
> I also notice that the logs are full
> "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match
> outer scope rule:
> L/DoorsView/test/complyserve/doorsview/utils/LabelsTest.java".

This is the same as bug 200646

Released to HEAD.

The fix is simple and fixes the Rename refactoring in a situation where the user cannot know how to work around the problem. Targetting 3.3.2.

(In reply to comment #4)
To reproduce, rename A#m() to k. This needs to find references that would be shadowed (such as the one in I) and finds the match in the import as a side effect.
